intro: Cupania anodonta, commonly known as the small-flowered cupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with humid climates. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cupania anodonta is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
